wikipedia_page.main: Tom Carson (born 26 March 1959 in Alexandria, West Dunbartonshire) is a Scottish football player and coach. Carson played as a goalkeeper for several clubs, including Dundee, Raith Rovers and Dumbarton. He later managed Dumbarton between 2000 and 2002.

response: Having gone through a mediocre first season in charge,Dumbarton move out but not up, BBC Sport, 30 June 2000. he resigned from his position in the autumn of 2000.Moller-Neilson in line for Dumbarton, The Scotsman, 6 November 2000. Brown was succeeded by his former assistant Tom Carson.D-day arrives for caretaking duo, BBC Sport, 11 November 2000.
Born in Helensburgh, Argyll & Bute, Scotland, Joe was brought up in the town of Alexandria, West Dunbartonshire. His younger brother, Tom Carson, was also a footballer and Dumbarton manager.

In October 2001 McParland was appointed Director of Football at Dumbarton but was released from his role in May 2002 amidst rumours that he did not get on with manager Tom Carson.http://www.thefootballnetwork.net/main/s10/st3088.htm?print=1
* The League match against Clyde on 2 October marked Tom Carson's 100th appearance for Dumbarton in all national competitions - the 86th Dumbarton player to reach this milestone.
* Between the league game against Raith Rovers on 25 February and the league game against Clydebank on 7 April, Tom Carson did not concede a single goal - a record of 655 minutes.
